title: The Pioneer Burro
creator_credit: Pat Dowling Pictures, Pat Dowling and Thomas Stanton
brief_description: Describes the role of the burro and the prospector during the California gold rush and development of the West. The burro was not only the prospector’s companion but also carried supplies and equipment, found water in the desert and foraged for his own food. Shows methods of finding and recovering gold by means of pan and cradle.
